channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Epstein’s survivors demanded justice, Trump fumed that not enough attention was being given to his achievements.

item.title: Judge rules Trump administration's funding freeze against Harvard was unlawful
item.description: The decision from U.S. District Judge Allison Burroughs is a massive victory for Harvard University.

Trump suggests National Guard could go into New Orleans, a blue city in a red state

item.title: Florida plans to end all childhood vaccine mandates, first state to do so

item.title: Judge blocks Trump's $2.2 billion Harvard funding freeze
item.description: A federal judge has stopped the Trump administration's attempt to axe $2.2 billion in research funding for Harvard University.

item.title: Trump calls Epstein files 'irrelevant' as Massie petition picks up steam
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson and the White House are opposing a bipartisan push to compel the DOJ to release all the files related to Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: At least 15 dead, 18 injured after streetcar derails in Lisbon, city says
item.description: At least five people are in serious condition following the crash in Lisbon, according to the city's communications department.
